intro: Fuirena latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf fuirena, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting well to the island's unique climate. Its flowers bloom in the spring and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, Fuirena latifolia is considered a rare and endemic species.
